did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Otto Kinkeldey Papers, 1898-1962
did.langmaterial: Collection material in English, French, German, and Latin.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains offprints of articles by Otto Kinkeldey and others, correspondence, documents related to the Committee on Graduate Study in Music (1938), Kinkeldey's transcriptions of musical works, and one of his own compositions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Otto Kinkeldey Papers, 1898-1962, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Timothy Gudlewski and John Bewley.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Otto Kinkeldey (1878-1966) was among the most prominent and influential of the first generation of musicologists and music librarians in the United States. He earned his Master of the Arts degree in English literature and philosophy at New York University in 1900. After continuing studying music with Edward MacDowell at Columbia University for two years Kinkeldey moved to Germany to study at the Akademie Institut für Kirchenmusik and at the University of Berlin where his musicology professors included Johannes Wolf, Oskar Fleischer, Max Friedländer, and Hermann Kretzschmar. He received his Ph.D. from the University of Berlin in 1909.

In addition to receiving his musicological training in Germany, Kinkeldey also gained experience as a librarian while working as a cataloger for the Prussian government. His work involved cataloging music collections in church and town libraries. He was hired in 1909 to be the librarian for the Royal Academic Institute for Church Music in Breslau where he also worked at the University of Breslau as professor of organ and music theory. He taught with such distinction that the Prussian government granted him the honorary title, "Royal Prussian Professor" in 1910.

Kinkeldey returned to the United States in 1914 and was named chief of the Music Division of the New York Public Library in 1915. His work was interrupted while he was enlisted in the United States Army in 1917-1919. Kinkeldey resigned his post at the New York Public Library in 1923. He left to become head of the Music Department at Cornell University but returned to the New York Public Library for the years 1927-1930.

Cornell University created the first faculty position in musicology in 1930 and appointed Kinkeldey to the position. From 1930-1946 he also served as University Librarian at Cornell. After he retired from Cornell University he continued his career in several locations as a visiting faculty member, including Harvard, Princeton, Illinois University, Berkeley, and North Texas University.

Kinkeldey was one of the founding members of the American Musicological Society in 1941 and its first president. He was also among the founders of the Music Library Association in 1931 and served as its first president. He was instrumental in establishing the standards for graduate programs in music in the United States. His research and writings encompass both musicological and bibliographical studies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains twenty-one of Kinkeldey's published writings (two of which are only abstracts of presentations), documents from the 1936 meeting of the Committee on Graduate Study in Music chaired by Howard Hanson that established guidelines for music graduate programs, correspondence concerning a publication of the hymnal, Zion's Harfeand seventeen writings by other authors, some with inscriptions to Kinkeldey or accompanied by correspondence to him. The collection also contains eleven items of assorted correspondence, four folders of program materials, and five folders of paleographic examples.

The musical portion of the collection reflects Kinkeldey's research interests. The transcriptions pre-date commercially available transcriptions made later by other musicologists. Many of the transcriptions were used in his doctoral dissertation Orgel und Klavier in der Musik des 16. Jahrhunderts. Some of the musical works in Series IX were separated from original placements within compilations in order to better identify the contents.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in nine series:

item.ref: II. Committee on Graduate Study in Music

Committee on Graduate Study in Music, 1936-1937

scopecontent.p: Documents related to the Special Committee on Graduate Study in Music jointly sponsored by the Music Teachers National Association and the National Association of Schools of Music. The committee was first authorized in December 1933. The enclosed contents pertain to the committee's meeting December 30, 1936 at the joint conventions of the Music Teachers National Association, National Association of Schools of Music, American Musicological Society, and Phi Mu Alpha Fraternity in Chicago, Illinois and subsequent documents. The authors of the typescript documents are not stated.

Amor in uon gentile, Partesi con dolore, and Si dolce non sono (2nd part). The score of the last work is an ozalid reproduction. There is also a copy of the last work as it appears in the Squarcialupi Codex.

scopecontent.p: Tabulature pour le jeu dorgues, espinettes et manichordions sur le plain chant de cunctipotens et Kyrie Fons. Avec leurs et in terra. Patrem. Sanctus et Agnus dei. [Paris, 1531]. (Königliche Hof u Staatsbibliothek München Mus. fr. 232). Kyrie ; Christe ; Kyrie [through Fol. BIII] -- Magnificat sur les huit tons avec Te Deum laudamus et deux Preludes, le tout mys en tabulature des Orgues Espinettes et Manicordions, et telz semblables instrumentz... 1530. Preludium Fol L1(v) ; Prelude sur le chacun ton Fol LIV(v) ; Magnificat primi toni Fol NI ; Secundus versus Fol NIV -- Treze Motetz musicaulx avec ung Prelude, le tout reduict en la Tabulature des Orgues Espinettes et Manicordions et telz semblables instrumentz... Kal. Aprilis 1531. Fortuna desperata Fol 83 AaIII (v) ; Sicut malus Fol 89 ; Prelude Fol 119 (v) -- Dixneuf chansons musicales reduictes en la tabulature des Orgues Espinettes Manichordions, et telz semblables instrumentz musicaulx... Idibus Januraii 1530. Fors seulement Fol 18 (v) -- Vingt et cinq chansons musicales reduictes en la tabulature des Orgues Espinettes Manichordions, et telz semblables instrumentz musicaulx... Kal. 1530. [Contents listed but no musical examples transcribed] -- Vingt et six chansons musicales reduictes en la tabulature des Orgues Espinettes Manichordions, et telz semblables instrumentz musicaulx... Non. Februaii 1530. Ma bouche rit Fol 110 (v) -- Quatorze gaillardes neuf paven nes sept branles et deux basses dances le tout reduict de musique en la tabudu jeu dorgues espinettes manichordions a telz semblables instrumentz musicaulx ... [1531]. Pavane Fol 1 (v) ; Gaillarde sur la pavane -- Vingt et six chansons musicales reduictes en la tabulature des Orgues Espinettes Manichordions, et telz semblables instrumentz musicaulx... Non. Februaii 1530. Le content est riche Fol XCII (v) (includes text).

unittitle.title: Euterpe. Sospir che del bel petto

L'Euterpe di Domenico Brunetti, Bolognese. Opera musicali di madrigali, canzonette, arie, stanze, e scherzi diversi in dialoghi, & echo, a una, due, tre, et quattro voci, da cantarsi in theorba, arpicordo, & altri stromenti, ..., 1606

note.p: Ink manuscript.
Melodic line, with words, and bass only.

scopecontent.p: Sospir che del bel petto.

did.unittitle: Buus, Giacques, d. 1565 Intabolatura d'organo Intabolatura d'organo di ricercari di M. Giacques Buus ... Libro primo, September 24, 1904

Copied from the British Library K.1.f16, 1549 printing by Antonio Gardane.
"London, Sept. 24, 1904"--At end of score.

scopecontent.p: Recercar primo (Fol. Aii) -- Recercar secondo (Fol. D) -- Recercar terzo (Fol. F(v)) -- [Recercar quarto] (Fol. GII(v)).

did.unittitle: Buus, Giacques, d. 1565 Intabolatura d'organo. No. 1 Ricercar no. 1 aus Intabolatura d'organo do ricercari di M. Giaches Buus, Lib. 1, Venetia 1549, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.

This work is the first ricercar in Intabolatura d'organo and the first ricercar in the Ricercars, book 2 (1549). The transcription includes the first 38 measures of the full score on four staves from the latter source and the entire work from the Intabolatura on two staves. There is also a note indicating that a source for the full score version was Raymund Schlecht's Geschichte der Kirchenmusik (1879).
Title on wrapper: Beilage III Buus.
Contained on pages 245-259 of Kinkeldey's Orgel und Klavier in der Musik des 16. Jahrhunderts.

did.unittitle: Buus, Giacques, d. 1565 Ricercars, book 1. No. 1 Recercari di M. Iacques Buus ... Libro primo, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.
Transcription on four staves of the first 79 measures.
Information about Adriano Willaert's Fantasie Ricercari contrapunti a 3 voci (1559) is on the back cover.

did.unittitle: Campion, Thomas, 1567-1620 Songs, lute, viol acc. Selections Booke of ayres, set foorth to be song to the lute, orpherian, and base violl ... 1601, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.
The original collection contains 21 songs by Campion and 21 songs by Philip Rosseter.
Transcription for keyboard and voice, with text beneath vocal line.

scopecontent.p: My sweetest Lesbia ; Though you are yoong and I am olde ; I care not for these ladies ; Follow thy faire sunne / Thomas Campion -- If she forsakes me ; Sweete come againe ; And would you see my Mistris face ; No grave for woe ; If I urge my kinde desires ; What harts content can he finde ; / Philip Rosseter.

Muiscal transcriptions accompanied by textual notes.

did.unittitle: Lasso, Orlando di, 1532-1594 Chansons, voices (4-6), book 3. Susanne ung jour Susanne ung jour. 1. 5 Stimmung Satz von Lassus, 2. Orgelbearbeitung von Andrea Gabrieli, 3. Anfang der Orgelbearbeitung von Ammerbach, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.

Two scores vertically aligned. The top score is in five staves for the five-voice setting of Lasso's work. The bottom score is the keyboard arrangement of Lasso's work on two staves. It is from the publication, Canzoni alla francese et ricercari ariosi tabulate per sonar sopra istromenti da tasti dall Andrea Gabrieli. Libro V. Venetia, 1605. There is a separate five-stave transcription ([3] pages) of the first fourteen measures of the Ammerbach tablature (1571). The first fourteen measure numbers of the Gabrieli score are marked with red pencil to indicate where the Ammerbach would align.
Contained on pages 264-274 of Kinkeldey's Orgel und Klavier in der Musik des 16. Jahrhunderts.

did.unittitle: Sermisy, Claudin de, ca. 1490-1562 Content est riche en ce monde I Libro de le canzoni francese --- per Andrea Antigo intagliate. Venedig (O. Scotto) 1535, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.

Two double-staved scores vertically aligned. The top score contains only the altus and bass voice parts of Sermisy's chanson with the text written beneath the top voice. This matches the copy in the Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Munich. The bottom score is the keyboard arrangement contained in Pierre Attaingnant's 1530 Paris publication, Vingt et six chansons musicales.
Note in caption: Aus Beilage IV.
Contained on pages 260-263 of Kinkeldey's Orgel und Klavier in der Musik des 16. Jahrhunderts.

II Fol 32v) -- Vollstandige Harmonie-Wechsel (Fol 33) Oktavschritte im Bass (Ebenda) -- Wie man beim Fantasieren vorgeht (Th. II, Fol 120v) -- [Fantasie concierto] ([Th. II],Fol 121) -- Exemplo de unisonar a quatro semibreves por las compuestas ([Th. II], Fol 42) -- Exemplo de quando entra primero el contrabaxo (Th. II, Fol 73v) -- Quando el passo se haze en quarta ... (Th. II, Fol 74) -- [Quando el passo se haze quinta ...] ([Th. II], Fol 75) -- Exemplo de quando la voz del un duo ... ([Th. II], Fol 77) -- Exemplo de quando en lugar del segundo duo, se tañen a tres vozes con diversas consonancias ... ([Th. II], Fol 78) -- Exemplo de quando las mismas vozes que han concluydo el passo ... ([Th. II], Fol 79) -- Del modo de tañer los passos sueltos Cap. XXXV ([Th. II], Fol 79v) -- Arte de tañer (([Th. II], Fol 80) -- Del modo de asir un duo con otro sin clausula Cap. XXXVIII ([Th. II], Fol 82v) -- [Exemplo de todo lo sobre dicho] ([Th. II], Fol 83v) -- Del entrar las vozes medio copas antes dela clausula ([Th. II], Fol 90) -- Del entrar las vozes enel segundo lugar dela clausula ([Th. II], Fol 106) -- Primero del cesolfaut ([Th. I], Fol 72v) [two copies].

did.unittitle: Trostlicher Liebein seven versions, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.
Sources include compilations by Hans Gerle and Hans Newslider.

did.unittitle: Venetianische Opera Sinfonien. Abschriften von Kretzschmar, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.
Title from 16 page score.
Possibly related to Hermann Kretzschmar's article, Die venetianische Oper und die Werke Cavallis und Cestis’ in Vierteljahrsschrift für Musikwissenschaft : viii (1892), 1–76.

scopecontent.p: Score 1. Sinfonie zu Doriclea, 1645 ; Sinfonie zu Eligobalo, 1659 ; Ercole, 1662 / Fr. Cavalli ( Cavalli, Pier Francesco, 1602-1676) -- Il Tito, 1666 ; Argia, 1669. Prologue and Act I, scene 1 opening / M. A. Cesti ( Cesti, Antonio, 1623-1669) -- Marcello, 1670 / G. Ant. Boretti ( Boretti, Giovanni Antonio, ca. 1640-1672) -- Seleuco, 1666. Sinfonia and Act III, scene 15 ; Adelaide (Trompetenouverture), 1672 / M. A. Sartorio ( Sartorio, Antonio, 1630?-1681) -- Candaule, 1679 / PoA. Ziani ( Ziani, Pietro Andrea, 1616-1684).
Score 2. Sinfonie avant opera Griselda (1721, Text Rusponi) [incomplete Presto movement] / A. Scarlatti ( Scarlatti, Alessandro, 1660-1725).
Score 3. Sinfonie [complete three movement Sinfonia from the opera L'Amor volubile, e tiranno] / Scarlatti ( Scarlatti, Alessandro, 1660-1725).

did.unittitle: Verovio, Simone, fl. 1575-1608 Diletto spirituale. Selections Diletto spirituale, Canzonette a tre a quattro voci composte de diversi eccmi. musici, Racolta da Simone Verovio ... Roma, 1586, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.
Pages numbered 21-24.
Contained on pages 280-282 of Kinkeldey's Orgel und Klavier in der Musik des 16. Jahrhunderts.
Accompanied by earlier draft (4 page ink manuscript).
Accompanied by leaf marked Beilage V.

scopecontent.p: Jesu decus angelicum / Felice Anerio -- Jesu mi dulcissime / Felix Anerius.

did.unittitle: Vicentino, Nicola, 1511-ca. 1576 Antica musica ridotta alla moderna prattica. Dolce mio ben Essempio della prima parte di uno madrigale a quattro voci ... , undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.
From Vicentino's Antica musica ridotta alla moderna prattica, Rome, A. Barre, 1555, Book III, Chapter 52, fol. 67v.
Transcribed without accompanying words.

did.unittitle: Virdung, Sebastian, b. 1465? Musica getutscht. Sancta et immaculata virginita Aus Virdungs Musica getutscht, 1511. Sancta et immaculata virginitas ..., undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.
Transcription in keyboard format.

did.unittitle: Warren, Samuel P. (Samuel Prowse), 1841-1915 Solomon's prayer Solomon's prayer (I Kings VIII): choir responses, undated

note.p: Ink manuscript.
Parts (2 pages each) for soprano, alto, tenor, and bass.
Slightly different from the same responses published in Selected readings for the church service, with choir responses (1909), with readings selected by James M. Ludlow and music by Samuel P. Warren.

did.unittitle:
Unidentified Fanfares for brass and timpani,
undated

physdesc.extent: 1 manuscript score (2 pages) and 8 manuscript instrumental parts ; 35 cm.

note.p: Ink manuscript.
Parts for Tromba in C I, II, and II, Corno in F I and II (on one page), Trombone I and II (on one page), and Timpani.

scopecontent.p: Seven short works for which only the trumpet parts contain all of the music.

did.unittitle: Unidentified Tanz, undated

note.p: Scored for four unspecified instruments.
Ink manuscript.

did.unittitle: Unidentified Tho I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not love, undated

physdesc.extent: 1 leaf of manuscript music ; 27 x 25 cm.

note.p: Pencil manuscript.
Fragment consisting chiefly of a single melody line in bass clef with text beneath it.
Text from the Bible, Corinthians I:13.
